synthesis_conditions.chemicals_used: Cu(MeCOO)2·H2O (2.00 g, 10.02 mmol), Hpz (1.40 g, 20.56 mmol), MeCN (210 mL)
synthesis_conditions.washing_method: washed with 3 portions of 20 mL of MeCN

synthesis_conditions.chemicals_used: Copper(II) propionate (0.96 g, 4.6 mmol), Hpz (0.96 g, 14.2 mmol), MeCN (70 mL)
synthesis_conditions.time: stirred for 2 h and let to stay overnight

synthesis_conditions.equipment: vacuum pump (0.1 mm Hg) or without pumping at 130 °C
synthesis_conditions.description: Solid compound 1 was dried to obtain a beige solid identified as 3.

About 200 mg of 3 were exposed to various reagents through a serum cap or a faucet in a Schlenk tube under vacuum. The sorption was favored by gently shaking the vial for periods varying from a few minutes to days.
Compound 4c was obtained by reacting anhydrous Cu(MeCOO)2 with Hpz in anhydrous MeCN.
